intro: Erigeron rivalis, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. It produces small blue to purple ray flowers surrounded by yellow disk flowers, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its foliage is usually hairy and has a somewhat aromatic scent.
